About

I moved from Miami to DC in the cold, cold winter of December 2013. Alone here, with not much to do outside of work, I took to roaming the streets and trying to see as many sights as I could. Once the museum bucket list was complete, DC's neighborhoods became an attractive subject of exploration. Dropping my shy only-child demeanor, I started talking to strangers and learning a bit about the city's recent history. Probably the most interesting aspect of DC (to me at least) is its gentrification and massive overhaul in the last 10 to 20 years, as well as the unintended consequences of those changes. Here, I hope to work on my writing and photography skills, but, more importantly, I want to tell stories about the people and situations I run into. Maybe we'll all learn something here!

  • Keep Trackin'

Documenting my experiences and others' stories as I come across them
